intro: Seridia pullata, commonly known as the small-flowered seridia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the plant is often found in open habitats. Seridia pullata is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological role.
